q:
To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache to store frequently accessed data in memory. You have executed the following commands in redis-cli. 

> SADD key1 "a"
> SADD key1 "b"
> SADD key1 "c"
> SADD key1 "d"
> SADD key2 "d"
> SADD key2 "e"
> SADD key3 "a"
> SADD key3 "d"
> SADD key3 "f"
> SDIFFSTORE key3 key1 key2

What is the output of the " SMEMBERS key3" command in redis cli?

Options

1.

1) "c"
2) "b"

2.

1) "a"
2) "d"
3) "f"

3.

1) "c"
2) "b"
3) "e"
4) "a"

4.

1) "b"
2) "c"
3) "f"
4) "e"

To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache to store frequently accessed data in memory. You have executed the following commands in redis-cli. 

> SADD key1 "a"
> SADD key1 "b"
> SADD key1 "c"
> SADD key1 "d"
> SADD key2 "d"
> SADD key2 "e"
> SADD key3 "a"
> SADD key3 "d"
> SADD key3 "f"

What is the output of the "SDIFF key1 key2  key3" command in redis cli?

Options

1.

1) "b"
2) "c"
3) "f"
4) "e"

2.

1) "a"
2) "d"

3.

1) "c"
2) "b"

To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache to store frequently accessed data in memory. You have run the following commands in redis-cli. 

> SADD key1 "man"
> SADD key1 "pan"
> SADD key1 "can"
> SADD key2 "an"
> SADD key2 "man"
> SADD key2 "ran"
> SADD key2 "man"

What is the output of the following command in redis-cli:

> SINTER key1 key2

To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache to store frequently accessed data in memory. Redis Sets are good for expressing relations between objects. You want to use sets in order to implement tags. In order to do so, you have created a set for every object you want to tag. The set contains the IDs of the tags associated with the object.

If employee ID 2022 is tagged with tags 67, 128, 57 and 89, how can a set associate these IDs with the employees?

Options

1.

> sset tags employee:2022 67 128 57 89

2.

> sset employee 2022 tags 67
> sset employee 2022 tags 128
> sset employee 2022 tags 57
> sset employee 2022 tags 89

3.

> sadd employee:2022 tags 67
> sadd employee:2022 tags 128
> sadd employee:2022 tags 57
> sadd employee:2022 tags 89

4.

> sadd employee:2022:tags 67 128 57 89

To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache to store frequently accessed data in memory. How can you add elements to your Redis Set named "myset" in redis-cli and then print them?

Options

1.

> sset myset 1 2 3
> sshow myset

2.

> sset myset 1 2 3
> smembers myset

3.

> sadd myset 1 2 3
> smembers myset

4.

> sadd myset 1 2 3
> sget myset
